commits.message: feat: add commit list to review runner report metadata
style: consolidate multi-line function parameters into single lines in cc_review_cli.py

issues.description: Inconsistent code formatting - function parameters were consolidated to single lines
suggested_fixes: Consider reverting to multi-line parameter formatting for better readability when there are multiple parameters
Multi-line formatting is more consistent with Python style guides for functions with multiple parameters
The original formatting was easier to read and maintain

issues.description: Added unnecessary blank line after imports section
suggested_fixes: Remove the extra blank line after the imports to maintain consistent spacing
Python PEP 8 style guide recommends two blank lines after imports

issues.description: New metadata field 'commits' added without proper documentation
suggested_fixes: Update documentation to describe the new 'commits' field format and structure
Ensure the actual implementation populates this new field correctly
Consider adding example output to documentation

summary.overall_assessment: The changes in this branch are minor and primarily consist of style modifications and a small feature addition to the review report metadata. The most significant concern is the inconsistent code formatting changes that reduce readability without providing clear benefits.
recommendations: Consider reverting the code formatting changes in cc_review_cli.py to maintain consistency with the project's existing style
If formatting changes are desired, they should be applied project-wide using an automated formatter like Black or Ruff
Ensure that the new 'commits' metadata field is properly implemented and documented
Update related documentation to reflect the new metadata structure
